metadata.title: CVE-2020-29668 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
Sympa before 6.2.59b.2 allows remote attackers to obtain full SOAP APIaccess by sending any arbitrary string (except one from an expired cookie)as the cookie value to authenticateAndRun.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29668` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sympa - 6.2.58~dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sympa package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.58~dfsg-2').
